title.narrative: Support to Special Envoy of the Secretary General on Myanmar

description.narrative: To support democratic transition and national reconciliation through countrywide initiatives on tolerance and acceptance of diversity in Myanmar.

mailing-address.narrative: No. 3, Pyay Road, 6 Miles, Hlaing Township, Yangon, Myanmar

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Instalment is to be made prior to the project start date 1 January 2021.
One disbursement will be made in December 2020.

Accountability and transitional justice are prudently integrated into the political discussions to bring about the positive change in Myanmar, taking into consideration the Secretary-General’s emphasis on addressing accountability, including through cooperation with relevant United Nations and other international mechanisms, as essential for genuine reconciliation.
Improved level of integration of accountability and justice in SE’s political engagements with the stakeholders.

target.value: Improved level of integration of accountability and justice in SE’s political engagements with the stakeholders.

actual.value: Due to the stagnant political situation in Myanmar, the issue of accountability went only as far as highlighting the need for accountability and justice in the attempt to find a solution and move on, rather than the substantive integration. The actual contribution to the outcomes were made more at the level of ensuring that legal and accountability related aspects are sufficiently and accurately integrated into the Special Envoy’s engagement with stakeholders and also strengthened cooperation between other mandated UN mechanisms by way of sharing contacts, and initiating the idea of Myanmar Witness project.

title.narrative:
SE’s engagements with different stakeholders calibrated by approaches and focuses which enhances her comparative advantages including her convening and mediation role through which she can make the expertise available from the UN System.
The point of reference provides accurate, factual and impartial information on a number of contentious issues vis a vis the roles of different parts of the UN, regional organizations, political actors and the international community and mechanisms in the post-February environment in Myanmar characterised by multi-faceted challenges and regional implications.

Improved level of effectiveness in the mediation role of the Special Envoy.
Levels of uptake by the audiences on the factual information provided.

target.value: Improved level of effectiveness in the mediation role of the Special Envoy. Levels of uptake by the audiences on the factual information provided.

actual.value: It was the most challenging of all in the course of 2021, as hardening positions by conflicting parties left little room for the Special Envoy to take up her mediation role. This was also compounded by the fact that her departure from the position was announced in February 2021, which meant that she was bounded by her own timeline. Her mediation role was also challenged by differing views within the Security Council and there was no consensus among the SC members on what they considered the way out. Despite the challenges, the Special Envoy has taken advantages of her social and political capitals she had acquired prior to the coup with the Tatmadaw leadership and other democratic and conflicting actors and kept their faith in the role of the Special Envoy as potential mediators to prepare grounds for mediation.

title.narrative: Strengthened accountability and transitional justice as a part of national reconciliation efforts and bringing justice to the victims.

Domestic accountability and justice mechanisms around ICOE recommendations are strengthened. The Government initiates steps towards the introduction of contextually-appropriate transitional justice mechanisms.

target.value: Domestic accountability and justice mechanisms around ICOE recommendations are strengthened. The Government initiates steps towards the introduction of contextually-appropriate transitional justice mechanisms.

title.narrative: International support towards creating conditions conducive for the safe, voluntary, dignified and sustainable return of Rohingya refugees are well informed by accurate and comprehensive analyses of the ground situation, needs and wishes of affected population based on a broad range of consultations including with community-based organizations, women’s groups and the most vulnerable.
Improved understanding among the member states on the feasibility of refugee return in the post-coup environment and the need to keep the Rohingya agenda in the discussions.

target.value: Improved understanding among the member states on the feasibility of refugee return in the post-coup environment and the need to keep the Rohingya agenda in the discussions. And Continued support to local initiatives which aims for improved social cohesion and solidarities.

actual.value: The Special Envoy provided timely and contextual assessments of the changing dynamics of the situation of Rohingyas in Rakhine State, and more broadly the larger level discussions around Rohingya inclusion as a part of political discussions to find sustainable solutions for Myanmar. These assessments were appreciated especially in New York as her exposure to the Security Council and to the PRs has significantly increased post-coup. Meanwhile, community-level initiatives which the Special Envoy supported prior to and post coup indicated her continued support have provided them with much needed moral support and the sense of confidence in the direction they are going.
